page.title: 15Farming (Bradfield area)
page.content: Because of the altitude, exposed nature of the area, the relatively poor soil and steep slopes, farming tends to be pastoral.Sheep and cattle graze on the sloping fields. Some pasture has been improved by adding fertiliser and by cutting drainage ditches. The only crop is grass.Some is cut by machine in June and stored in a silo for winter fodder. The farmers buy and sell their livestock in Penistone and Bakewell. Many farm buildings are now occupied by people working in one of the nearby towns. Such people either sell or rent their land. The farms which are still "working farms" have increased their acreage as much as four times over the last 20 years.
